## Data Exploration of Raw Carbon Data


```{r}
getwd()

#load all required packages
library(tidyverse)
library(dplyr)
library(lubridate)

```



```{r}
#import data
carbon.data <- read.csv("./raw-data/NTL-LTER_Lake_Carbon_Raw.csv")

#View data
#View(carbon.data)
```

```{r}
#exploratory
colnames(carbon.data)
str(carbon.data)
summary(carbon.data)
dim(carbon.data)
```

```{r}
#set date
carbon.data$sampledate <- as.Date(carbon.data$sampledate, format = "%m/%d/%y")
head(carbon.data$sampledate)
```

```{r}
#data visualization
ggplot(carbon.data) +
  geom_histogram(aes(x=absorbance))

ggplot(carbon.data) +
  geom_histogram(aes(x=doc))

ggplot(carbon.data) +
  geom_freqpoly(aes(x=absorbance, color = depth)) #shows absorbance differences depending on depth in lake

ggplot(carbon.data) +
  geom_point(aes(x = absorbance, y = doc))

ggplot(carbon.data) +
  geom_point(aes(x = depth_id, y = absorbance))

ggplot(carbon.data) +
  geom_point(aes(x = sampledate, y = absorbance))

ggplot(carbon.data) +
  geom_point(aes(x=depth_id, y = absorbance))
```

```{r}
#filtering
carbon.data.processed <- carbon.data %>%
  filter(depth %in% c("PML", "Hypolimnion", "Epilimnion", "Metalimnion")) %>%
  filter(lakename %in% c("Peter Lake", "Paul Lake", "East Long Lake", "Tuesday Lake", "West Long Lake")) %>%
  select(lakename:depth_id, DIC_mg, DIC_uM, doc, absorbance)

```

```{r}
#write csv
write.csv(carbon.data.processed, row.names = FALSE, file = "./processed-data/NTL-LTER_Carbon_Data_Processed.csv")
```
